chargeHist.descr: Harboring/Aiding a Felon (A/B/C/D or unclassified felony/life)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelina Jan Ruesch

records.addlTxt: Plea date scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Defendant Angelina Jan Ruesch not in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn appeared by video for Angelina Jan Ruesch.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case called with co-defendant cases.
Parties in court for scheduling.
Defense counsel advises Court they are in resolution posture and requests adjournment for plea hearing.
Discussion with the parties; co-defendant Case# 22CF00305 scheduled for sentencing on December 9, 2022.

Court orders this case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Reserve Branch 25.

Clerk:  jms

Attorney Nicholas M Weege in court with Melissa P Calvert.  Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Judge Franke held the trial for co-defendant Chambliss and has agreed to take all the co-defendant cases.  All parties are in agreement.  Court orders case adjourned for a scheduling conference in Judge Franke.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Angelina Jan Ruesch in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Angelina Jan Ruesch in custody.  Paul Tiffin for Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense request an adjourned date.  Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Angelina Jan Ruesch not in court, in custody.  Defendant's Appearance Waived.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Status Conference.  State requested adjournment.  Defense is not in Trial posture.  Defense does not Object to States adjournment request.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Angelina Jan Ruesch not in court, in custody.  
Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin via video means.
Case in court for status conference. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Discussions placed on the record. Court informs all parties that there will not be any more adjourned statuses. Court sets matter before Branch 15 for adjourned hearing.  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
SIGNED and Filed. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense.

Defendant Angelina Jan Ruesch in court with attorney Kerri Cleghorn as friend of the court. Defendant Angelina Jan Ruesch in custody. Angelina Jan Ruesch appeared by video means with Attorney.
Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for status of counsel. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Office of the Public Defender has yet to appoint counsel. 
Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with Defendant. Court found Defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court.  Defendant requested court appointed counsel. The court appointed Atty. Kerri Cleghorn, present in court via Zoom video means, to represent Defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court finds that there will be a NO REPAY order for Defendant. 
Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned for Status hearing before Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Court RESCHEDULES Status Conference scheduled for 4/20/22 to allow OPD additional time to appoint. Case remains calendared before Branch 15 for Status of counsel hearing on April 29, 2022 at 1:30pm.

Defendant Angelina Jan Ruesch in court with attorney Alex Lockwood. Defendant Angelina Jan Ruesch in custody. Attorney Lockwood appeared by video means.
Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for an Arraignment. Filed, original information; copy served on Defendant. Defendant acknowledges receipt of information. Information formally read in court and pleads not guilty. Discussions placed on the record. Previously appointed counsel that was appointed by OPD is no longer on this case for reasons placed on the record.  This Clerk will notify the Office of Public Defender of need for appointment of counsel for Defendant on this date. Case remains calendared before Br. 15 for status of counsel. Defendant may appear via Zoom for this in person hearing.  Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

MATTER HEARD OFF RECORD AND WITH COURT APPROVAL.
Arraignment scheduled for today has been RESCHEDULED due to defendant being in custody in another county. Arraignment will be conducted before branch 15 in SB506 on March 17, 2022 at 8:45am.

Defendant Angelina Jan Ruesch in court with Attorney Charles Robert Roozen.  Defendant Angelina Jan Ruesch in custody.  Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 15, Judge J.D. Watts. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Case is adjourned to Br. 15.  Arraignment scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angelina Jan Ruesch in court with Attorney Jason Findling on behalf of Attorney Charles Robert Roozen.  Defendant Angelina Jan Ruesch in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Roozen is in trial. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Angelina Jan Ruesch in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Angelina Jan Ruesch in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Angelina Jan Ruesch appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
